author: Poster
title: Deron Freeman
text:
Deron Freeman: A Testament to Diverse Excellence from the Ball Field to the Courtroom
Introduction
In a world where career paths are often linear, Deron Freeman stands out as a shining example of how diverse experiences can culminate in a successful and fulfilling career. From the baseball fields of Windsor High School to the esteemed corridors of legal practice in Hartford, CT, Freeman's journey is nothing short of inspiring.
Early Beginnings: A Star on the Diamond
Deron's story begins at Windsor High School, where he was not just any student; he was a star athlete on the 1991 Baseball State Championship team. His prowess on the baseball field earned him a scholarship to Fairfield University, marking the beginning of a journey that would see him excel in both sports and academics. Graduating in 1992 with a robust 3.5 GPA, Deron showcased his ability to balance a demanding sports schedule with rigorous academic commitments.
Transitioning from Academia to the Professional World
After his time at Fairfield, Deron decided to take a year off from academics. This break led him to work as an associate at Enterprise Rent-a-Car in Hartford, CT. This phase of his life, though seemingly unrelated to his future career, equipped Deron with real-world skills and experiences that would prove beneficial in his legal pursuits.
The Law School Years: Laying the Foundation for Legal Success
In 1997, Deron took a significant turn in his career path by enrolling in Western New England College's School of Law in Springfield, Massachusetts. During his law studies, Deron began to display the same discipline and dedication that he had shown on the baseball field. His graduation in 2000 was the first step into a new world of legal challenges and achievements.
Mentorship and Growth in the Legal Field
Perhaps one of the most influential phases of Deron’s career was his experience working at his father’s law firm in his final year of law school. His father, Donald Freeman, a high-profile litigator in Hartford with over 35 years of experience, was not just a mentor but also a pivotal figure in Deron's legal training. Under his father’s guidance, Deron mastered the intricacies of civil motion practice, file development, client relations, litigation preparation, and the basics of criminal law.
Establishing a Legacy: The Law Offices of Deron Freeman
In 2003, armed with extensive knowledge and experience, Deron embarked on his own venture by establishing The Law Offices of Deron Freeman. Over the years, his firm has become a beacon of legal expertise in Hartford, renowned for its commitment to customer relations and high-level legal work.
Conclusion
Deron Freeman’s career trajectory is a powerful reminder that success is not confined to a single path. His journey from an athlete to a respected legal practitioner exemplifies how diverse experiences, when combined with dedication and hard work, can lead to remarkable achievements. Deron’s story is an inspiration to aspiring professionals in all fields, proving that with the right attitude and work ethic, the sky is the limit.

author: Grit Petersen
title: Kostenexplosion bei der Eingliederungshilfe
text:
Kostenexplosion bei der Eingliederungshilfe
Guten Morgen!
Menschen mit Behinderungen haben ein gesetzlich garantiertes Recht auf Teilhabe am gesellschaftlichen Leben - und das ist gut so. Wer diese Teilhabe ermöglichen will, muss Geld in die Hand nehmen. Doch das Land, das den Kommunen rund 80 Prozent der Kosten erstattet, hat ein Problem: Die Ausgaben der Eingliederungshilfe sind in Schleswig-Holstein aus verschiedenen Gründen um mehr als zehn Prozent gestiegen.
Die Politik will nun die Kostentreiber identifizieren, der Landesrechnungshof (LRH) hat bereits einen gefunden. Laut Präsidentin Gaby Schäfer (64) leben im Norden „überdurchschnittlich viele Menschen in besonders kostenintensiven stationären Einrichtungen“. Der Vorschlag des LRH, ambulante Angebote zu stärken, birgt viel Zündstoff. Denn eine Senkung der stationären Quote würde zu Lasten der Angehörigen gehen.
THEMA DES TAGES
Landesregierung muss mehr sparen als geplant, weil die Eingliederungshilfe immer teurer wird
"Ein Ende des Kostenanstiegs bei der Eingliederungshilfe ist nicht in Sicht", sagt Rechnungshof-Präsidentin Gaby Schäfer.
Quelle: Frank Molter/dpa
Vielen Städten und Kreisen in Schleswig-Holstein geht das Geld aus. Dafür gibt es insbesondere zwei Gründe. Infolge eines hohen Tarifabschlusses für den öffentlichen Dienst steigen die Personalkosten. Zugleich wachsen die Ausgaben der Eingliederungshilfe um mehr als zehn Prozent, weil auch das Hilfspersonal für Menschen mit Behinderungen besser bezahlt wird und es zudem mit gut 32.000 Hilfsempfängern mehr Bedürftige gibt als jemals zuvor.
Die Kostenexplosion bei der Eingliederungshilfe trifft auch das Land. Es erstattet den Kommunen rund 80 Prozent der Ausgaben und muss deshalb jetzt selbst stärker sparen. Das Sozialministerium beziffert den Mehrbedarf im laufenden Jahr auf bis zu 130 Millionen Euro und will jetzt untersuchen lassen, warum die Kosten aus dem Ruder laufen und wie sich die Ausgaben reduzieren lassen.
Der Landesrechnungshof (LRH) hat dazu einige Vorschläge. So soll etwa das Land beim Bund mehr Geld verlangen, weil der Bundestag 2016 das Bundesteilhabegesetz und damit einen größeren Leistungskatalog für Menschen mit Behinderung beschlossen hat. Dass der Bund die Mehrbelastung der Länder und Kommunen ausgleicht, ist allerdings zweifelhaft. Das schleswig-holsteinische Konnexitätsprinzip (wer die Musik bestellt, muss sie auch bezahlen) gilt nur für das Binnenverhältnis von Land und Kommunen. Der Bund ist also fein raus, kann schöne Beschlüsse fassen, die andere umsetzen und bezahlen müssen.
AKW-Tagung in Geesthacht: Gemeinden fordern Entschädigung
Zum ersten Mal hat die Arbeitsgemeinschaft Asketa in Geesthacht getagt. Im Mittelpunkt stand die Forderung nach finanzieller Kompensation, weil durch den langsamen Rückbau von Atomkraftwerken und fehlende Endlager jahrzehntelang Flächen blockiert bleiben. Tragisch: Achim Walter (54, FDP), Bürgermeister von Obrigheim, wurde während der Tagung tot aufgefunden.
Die blockierten Flächen behindern die Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten der Kommunen massiv – etwa für Industrie oder Energieprojekte. Gut zwei Millionen Euro pro kerntechnischer Anlage und zusätzlich 10.000 Euro pro gelagertem Castor-Behälter verlangen die Vertreter der Kommunen.
Asketa will ihre Forderungen direkt im Bundesumweltministerium vortragen. Politische Unterstützung wurde zugesagt. Ziel ist eine gesetzlich befristete Zwischenlagerung, klare Perspektiven für die Standorte – oder finanzielle Entschädigung vom Bund.
Northvolt: Die Opposition legt sich fest
Vertreter des Finanz- und des Wirtschaftsausschusses haben sich am Mittwoch im Kieler Landeshaus über den Fall des mittlerweile insolventen schwedischen Batterieherstellers Northvolt gestritten. Für SPD, FDP und SSW ist der Fall klar: Hätte man frühzeitig das eigens vom Bundeswirtschaftsministerium in Auftrag gegebene Gutachten der Wirtschaftsprüfer von PricewaterhouseCoopers im Detail gekannt, hätte man einer 300-Millionen-Euro-Anleihe des Landes nicht zugestimmt.
Bei CDU und Grünen schüttelt man darüber den Kopf. „Es gab gute Gründe für die Unterstützung von Northvolt“, sagte Grünen-Fraktionschef Lasse Petersdotter (35). Die Wahrscheinlichkeit einer vollständigen Rückzahlung samt Zinsen wurde demnach auf 86 Prozent geschätzt - die eines Totalverlustes auf unter ein Prozent. Allerdings hatten die Gutachter auf eine dürftige Datenbasis hingewiesen.
So ganz gibt die Landesregierung die Hoffnung auf ein florierendes Großunternehmen am Standort Heide nicht auf. Wenn es schon kein Batteriezellenhersteller werden sollte, kämen auch andere Branchen infrage. Im Landeshaus wird über die Rüstungsindustrie spekuliert. Das würde jedenfalls in diese Zeit passen.
Kupferklau an E-Ladesäulen: Erste Fälle jetzt auch in Schleswig-Holstein
Sauberer Schnitt, dickes Kabel geklaut: Unbekannte Täter haben auf dem Gelände des Kfz-Verbandes Schleswig-Holstein in Kiel zwei Schnellladesäulen unbrauchbar gemacht. Wer macht so etwas? Kupferdiebe? E-Auto Hasser? Bislang spricht viel für Diebstahl, nichts für eine pseudo-politische Botschaft.
Fakt ist: Der Ausbau der Ladeinfrastruktur ist ein Schlüssel für den Erfolg von Elektromobilität. Sabotage und Vandalismus verursachen erhebliche Kosten, die die Wirtschaftlichkeit der Anlagen belasten. Noch sind es in Schleswig-Holstein Einzelfälle, anders als im Süden der Republik.
KÖPFE
SCHLAGZEILEN ÜBER SCHLESWIG-HOLSTEIN
shz)
NDR)
Hamburger Abendblatt)
PROBEABSTIMMUNG: IHR VOTUM
20250702_SH_Umfrage_525_Newsletter
Quelle: Christoph Knoop
TERMINE AM 3. JULI
PROTOKOLLNOTIZ
Vom 17. Juli an ist der Verkauf von Lachgas als Partydroge an Minderjährige in Schleswig-Holstein verboten. Das Kabinett hat einer entsprechenden Verordnung des Gesundheitsministeriums gestern zugestimmt.
„Der missbräuchliche Konsum von Lachgas kann massive gesundheitsschädliche Folgen wie Herz-Kreislauf-Versagen und schwere Hirnschäden haben“, sagte Gesundheitsministerin Kerstin von der Decken (56, CDU). Vor allem Kinder und Jugendliche müssten vor den Auswirkungen von missbräuchlichem Konsum geschützt werden.
„Wir haben dieses landesweite Verbot auf den Weg gebracht, da eine bundesweite Regelung bislang nicht umgesetzt ist“, sagte von der Decken. Das Verkaufsverbot an Minderjährige gilt für sämtliche Verkaufsstellen - auch für den Online-Handel. Verstöße werden mit Bußgeldern bis 1000 Euro geahndet.
Unser "Politik in Schleswig-Holstein"-Newsletter
Jeden Morgen wissen, worüber Ihr Bundesland heute reden wird – mit unserem Newsletter "Politik in Schleswig-Holstein".
Mit meiner Anmeldung zum Newsletter stimme ich der Werbevereinbarung zu.
Vox Populi
Unser Artikel über erste Gemeinden in Schleswig-Holstein, die auf ihren Kita-Plätzen sitzen bleiben, hat sie am Mittwoch am meisten interessiert. Hier noch einmal zum Nachlesen:
Wir wünschen Ihnen einen schönen Donnerstag. Bis morgen, Ihre
Grit Petersen
Sie haben Themen, Informationen, Dokumente, zu denen Sie eine Recherche für sinnvoll erachten? Oder sonstige Anregungen, wie wir diesen Newsletter für Sie noch wertvoller machen können? Wir freuen uns über Post von Ihnen an politikinschleswigholstein@rnd.de.

author: Admin
title: Valley Dental Surgery & Implant Center Introduces Exclusive Services for State-of-the-Art Procedures in Dental Implants
text:
Santa Rosa, CA – Valley Dental Surgery & Implant Center, a leading institution in cutting-edge dental care, proudly announces the launch of exclusive services aimed at advancing the field of dental implants. With a commitment to excellence and innovation, the center introduces state-of-the-art procedures that redefine the standard of care in dental implantology.
Dental implants have revolutionized the approach to tooth replacement, offering a permanent solution that enhances oral health and restores natural aesthetics. Valley Dental Surgery & Implant Center recognizes the transformative potential of dental implants and introduces a suite of exclusive services designed to elevate the patient experience and outcomes.
At the core of these exclusive services is a focus on state-of-the-art procedures, leveraging the latest advancements in dental technology. Valley Dental Surgery & Implant Center employs cutting-edge diagnostic tools, precision planning, and innovative implant techniques to provide patients with the most advanced and effective solutions available in modern implant dentistry.
The team at
Valley Dental Surgery & Implant Center comprises highly skilled professionals, dedicated to staying at the forefront of dental innovation. With a wealth of expertise, they bring a patient-centric approach to every procedure, ensuring that each individual receives personalized care tailored to their unique needs and expectations.
These exclusive services go beyond conventional dental implant procedures, encompassing a comprehensive range of advanced treatments. From single-tooth implants to full-mouth rehabilitation, Valley Dental Surgery & Implant Center’s exclusive services cover a spectrum of solutions for patients seeking optimal oral health and functional restoration.
Valley Dental Surgery & Implant Center invites residents in the nearby community and surrounding areas (see
Google maps) to experience the benefits of these exclusive services. The center is now accepting new patients and encourages individuals to schedule appointments to explore the cutting-edge procedures offered.

author: Charles Shepherd
title: Orlando International Airport Takes A Bow Following A Year Of Awards And Recognitions
text:
Orlando International Airport Takes A Bow Following A Year Of Awards And Recognitions
ORLANDO, Fla. — This may be the season of giving, but Orlando International Airport (MCO) has been fortunate to have been on the receiving end of notable accolades spanning the entire year. Various organizations, publications and groups have recognized MCO for its achievements, facilities and personnel. While the awards ranged from the prestigious to the esoteric, the Board and staff of the Greater Orlando Aviation Authority (GOAA) celebrate every one.
With a focus on delivering a unique travel experience for more than 56 million annual passengers, Orlando International was proud to be recognized by the World Travel Awards as North America’s Leading Airport. Other awards for overall excellence included: Best Airport for Recreation by Global Traveler magazine and Best Family-Friendly Domestic Airport from WhereverFamily.com.
Terminal C, the largest project in airport history, received a host of engineering, construction and design awards:
• Project of the Year by Airport Business Magazine. The award was based on innovation, vision, impact and collaboration with key partners including HNTB, Fentress Architects, Burns Engineering, Hensel Phelps, and Turner Construction.
• Top Project of the Year — Engineering News-Record (ENR) Southeast.
• Excellence in Construction Project of the Year from the Central Florida Chapter of Associated Builders and Contractors (ABC).
• Eagle Award in Infrastructure from the Central Florida Chapter ABC.
• A+ Award from Architizer, an organization that spotlights architects and designers.
Another key sector where MCO stood out was sustainability. With attention to energy usage and water management practices, along with adhering to stricter building and materials standards, GOAA was lauded for its efforts with the following distinctions:
• Benjamin J. Siwinski Sustainability Award for Terminal C
• U.S. Green Building Council (USBC) Sustainability Technology Award — Terminal C
• USBC Marquee Green Building Legacy Award — Train Station
• Green Apple Environment Awards International Bronze Award for Terminal C
2023 has also been a year of accomplishments for Aviation Authority leadership. GOAA Chief Executive Officer Kevin Thibault was recognized as one of Orlando Business Journal’s 2023 C-Suite Honorees. He was also named one of Orlando Magazine’s “50 Most Powerful People of 2023.” Routes World, an international organization that supports the air transport industry, presented Chief Development Officer Vicki Jaramillo with the 2023 Individual Leadership Award. The GOAA Finance team, led by Chief Financial Officer Kathleen Sharman, received the Certificate of Excellence in Financial Reporting from the Government Finance Officers Association. Gary Trotta, Assistant VP of Operations at Orlando Executive Airport, was named to Airport Business Magazine’s 40 Under 40 list.
There were also a handful of atypical, yet still appreciated, recognitions:
• Best Carpet — Orlando Weekly
• Best Digital Signage for Public Spaces — Digital Signage Experience (DIZZIE)
• Favorite Airport Shopping — trazeetravel.com, a publication written for and by travelers ages 25-40
• Best Sit-Down Restaurants for Travelers – No. 2: Cask & Larder — USA Today
• Best Workplaces for Commuters — Center for Urban Transportation Research
And most recently, at the Airports Council International North America annual conference for Communications, Marketing and Customer Experience, MCO staff received first place honors in the Print Communications category for producing a commemorative book celebrating the opening of Terminal C.
The Greater Orlando Aviation Authority is proud to operate Orlando International Airport (MCO) and Orlando Executive Airport (ORL), two of Florida’s premier air travel gateways. MCO is a world-class global connector, serving more than 50 million annual passengers in its Main Terminal and Terminal C. Connected to an Intermodal Terminal Facility, Terminal C is an inventive structure that elevates the customer experience with 100% automated screening lanes at TSA checkpoints. ORL is conveniently located just miles from downtown Orlando and provides vital general aviation access to the heart of the region

author: @onlymyhealth
title: Ammonia Gas Leak Near Ennore Raises Health Concerns: Signs Of Ammonia In The Lungs And How To Treat It | Onlymyhealth
text: On the night of December 26, 2023, a significant ammonia gas leak from an underwater pipeline near Periyakuppam in Ennore sent shockwaves through the community, leading to widespread panic and health concerns. Residents reported difficulty in breathing and burning sensations in their eyes and faces, prompting hospitalizations and raising questions about the immediate and long-term effects of ammonia exposure. Community Outcry and Environmental Concerns Leaders from the fishing community in Ennore demanded that the area be declared affected by industrial accidents. They called for action against the responsible companies and compensation for those affected by the ammonia gas leak. Despite containment efforts, the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board recorded elevated levels of ammonia in the air and sea, surpassing safety standards. The incident has ignited concerns about both public health and environmental well-being, emphasizing the need for swift action and accountability. Understanding Ammonia: A Colorless Hazard Ammonia, a colorless gas with a strong odor, is a naturally occurring chemical found in the environment, including air, water, and soil. While it is present in plants, animals, and humans, it is also commonly used in various industrial and household cleaning products. Exposure to high levels of ammonia can result in irritation of the throat, lungs, mouth, skin, and eyes, with severe exposure potentially causing lung damage and, in extreme cases, fatalities. Also Read: [Risk Factors For Lung Cancer In Non-Smokers](https://www.onlymyhealth.com/risk-factors-for-lung-cancer-in-non-smokers-1699342625) Signs of Ammonia Exposure in the Lungs When ammonia enters the lungs, it can lead to short- or long-term respiratory problems. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) highlights the immediate effects, including burning sensations in the throat and windpipe, swelling of airways, and potential corrosion of lung membranes. Prolonged exposure may lead to respiratory distress, asphyxiation, and, in children, increased vulnerability due to higher concentrations near the ground. Symptoms of ammonia in the lungs may manifest as a burning throat, coughing, difficulty breathing, a tight chest, altered mental state, runny nose, eye irritation, and skin burns. The severity of these symptoms depends on factors such as the concentration and duration of exposure. Also Read: [Lung Health: 7 Different Ways To Know Your Lungs Are Functioning Properly](https://www.onlymyhealth.com/different-ways-to-know-your-lungs-are-functioning-properly-1694428138) Treating Ammonia Exposure Immediate medical attention is crucial for those exposed to ammonia, especially if symptoms of lung involvement are present. First aid measures include moving the affected person to an area with fresh air, keeping airways open, and providing respiratory support. Medical professionals may conduct physical examinations and tests, including blood and urine tests, to assess the extent of exposure and lung damage. While there is no specific antidote for ammonia poisoning, treatment focuses on managing and reducing the injury caused by exposure. This may involve supplying humidified oxygen, using bronchodilators to ease breathing, and diluting ingested ammonia with water or milk. Prevention and Protective Measures Preventing ammonia exposure involves avoiding high-risk settings and using protective equipment such as respirators, clothing, gloves, and eye protection. Swift reporting of leaks or spills, proper labeling and storage of ammonia containers, and decontamination measures contribute to minimizing risks. The recent ammonia gas leak near Ennore serves as a stark reminder of the potential health hazards posed by industrial incidents. Understanding the signs of ammonia exposure in the lungs and knowing how to treat it are crucial aspects of ensuring the well-being of affected individuals. As communities and authorities grapple with the aftermath of such events, proactive measures, accountability, and public awareness become essential in preventing and mitigating the impact of ammonia leaks on both human health and the environment.

organizations.name: ammonia gas leak near ennore raises health concerns

author: oblitum
title: #130 BMG despide a Roger Waters por sus dichos sobre Israel, Ucrania y Estados Unidos
text:
[Gerome](/user/Gerome)a [pagina12.com.ar](/go/link/3903510) [#39](c39#c-39) Tengo todos los de Pink Floyd y algunos de los de Waters, los de PF en formato vinilo y CD, todos comprados legalmente en su día.
Cierto que también me los he ido bajando en formato FLAC, porque creo que va a llegar un día en que no existan los reproductores de vinilos y CDs, pero una buena pasta llevo gastada a lo largo de mi vida, de la que seguro que se han beneficiado más las discográficas que los artistas
Y, por supuesto, si Waters saca algo en una discográfica nueva, lo pienso comprar, aunque sea como apoyo a la causa
[#106](c106#c-106) Hay gente que se piensa que porque piratas películas, no vas al cine. Con la música, lo mismo.
Sigo con mis LP en vinilo de Pink Floyd y de AC/DC. Me gusta ir contracorriente.
[#112](c112#c-112) Debo confesar que yo al cine casi no voy desde hace unos cuantos años. Por el precio estratosférico de las entradas y, sobre todo, porque no soporto a la gente alrededor masticando palomitas o con unas tremendas bandejas conteniendo hamburguesas, perritos calientes, cocacola y toda clase de basura.
Pero en su lugar también gasto una cantidad no despreciable en pagar varias plataformas de streaming.
[#48](c48#c-48) veo que por aqui tenemos al famoso anti anti fascismo del que he oido hablar en tantos lados. La censura güena, no como la otra que afecta a las cosas que a ti te gustan, que por supuesto es la buena
Es curioso que siempre intenteis usar el termino "izquierdista" o "ultra izquierdista" y los aludidos nunca se dan por ofendidos, ahora, dile a un derechista que su opinion lo es y... preparate para leer que Hitler era de izquierdas
Esto tiene que ser como la anorexia pero ideologica, teneis disforia ideologica.
También me he leído esta de la misma web (lo del negacionismo no va por el precisamente que es lo que me pensaba)
https://www.pagina12.com.ar/586545-los-stones-roger-waters-y-el-negacionismo
[#36](c36#c-36) Te compro eso de que "en España no pasa igual", pero nuestro presidente, bajo mi punto de vista se quedó infinitamente corto. Y ya ni hablemos con las relaciones que seguimos teniendo con esa máquina de picar carne que es Israel y con EEUU. Y lo de pertenecer a la OTAN siempre me ha parecido asqueroso.
[#74](c74#c-74) ¿La relación era del 50%? Lo digo porque cuando yo tenía una empresa, a mis empleados les hacía contratos Y tenía muy claro quién se quedaba con la plusvalía.
[#4](c4#c-4) definitivamente no hay manera de hacer un boicot a EE. UU. socio imprescindible y esencial de Israel.
[#107](c107#c-107) prueba en otro navegador, no sea que sea el tuyo el que esté infectado.
Si te pasa igual, y tienes opción, prueba desde otro pc.
Y si te sigue pasando pon una nota a
[@admin](/user/admin)
No me pasa, pero también tengo bloqueadas algunas cosas. Pero me extrañaría que no se quejase más gente.
Aunque tampoco sería la primera vez que se cuela algo malo (ej, publicidad que hacía cosas que no debía)

author: Francesc Anglada Benejam
title: Postureig lingüístic
text: L’any 2009 Joan Solà era convidat al Parlament de Catalunya. Va descriure les amenaces i el deteriorament de la llengua, encobert per les institucions. Davant ell, un auditori amb els responsables d’aquella situació i, alhora, els competents per posar-hi remei. En acabar el discurs, les senyories dempeus aplaudiren. Antoni Riera Vives, a l’Ara Balears, se’n feia ressò: «El sistema s’ho menja tot». La degradació de la llengua catalana ha seguit el seu camí fins avui, tant a les Illes com a Catalunya, amb independència de la representació dels respectius Governs. Els darrers anys, els Governs, «progressistes» i «catalanistes» en les diferents institucions de les Illes, no han servit per millorar-ne la salut. Ni tan sols en van fer motiu de preocupació. Tot el contrari, negaren el problema. A Catalunya, tres quarts del mateix. L’articulista del diari Ara, Albert Pla Nualart, treia les vergonyes de la política lingüística de Catalunya i, per extensió, les de casa nostra, entre les quals els 15 anys sense la publicació de cap enquesta d’ús lingüístic. Riu-te’n del Govern espanyol que no s’atreveix a demanar entre monarquia o república! I del referendum! Igual que els al·lots petits: no demanen allò que no volen saber. Igualment, Carme Junyent, per exemple Catradio 29/03/2022, feia el mateix respecte la immersió lingüística en l’àmbit educatiu, on la normalització lingüística, teòricament, està més regulada: «Ens han enganyat». Negar el problema ha estat la manera de dissimular la incapacitat i la voluntat de posar-hi solució. L’eina, la normalització lingüística, que en altre temps fou tan elogiada, i que tantes medalles va repartir, ha fet palesa la seva inutilitat i el llautó de les condecoracions. Tot era fum de formatjades. Per sort, l’entrada de la dreta al Govern -no dic extrema per no caure en la redundància- i la seva política contrària a la supervivència de la nostra llengua, permet espolsar-se les puces als qui ostentaven responsabilitats en els anteriors Governs i als qui restaren muts per afinitat o interessos polítics. Que l’actual Govern faci gala de voler enterrar la llengua no estranya a ningú. Però, si ho pot aconseguir serà perquè els anteriors varen deixar cavar el fossat.

author: abdelaziz Fathi
title: U.S. to sell $6.5 billion in Silk Road Bitcoin, missed $17.9B profit
text:
The U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) is set to auction off $6.5 billion worth of Bitcoin seized from the Silk Road, following a December 30 court ruling that resolved a lengthy legal battle over the ownership of these funds.
As of January 9, the U.S. government holds 198,000 BTC, worth $18.5 billion, according to Arkham Intelligence. The Bitcoin to be auctioned is part of this reserve.
Some analysts suggest the Biden administration might offload the Bitcoin before the transition of power to Donald Trump’s presidency. Fox Business contributor Jason Williams claimed the administration seeks to capitalize on the bull market, forcing the Trump administration to repurchase at higher prices.
“This is a blatant perversion of the government’s fiduciary responsibility,” Williams stated.
Bitcoin’s price fell by 2.78% following the court ruling, sparking concerns that a large-scale auction could exert further downward pressure on BTC prices.
Historically, U.S. government Bitcoin auctions had limited lasting effects on market prices. Between March 2023 and now, government-held Bitcoin dropped from 236,000 BTC to 198,000 BTC—a reduction of 38,000 BTC worth $3.54 billion. Despite this sell-off, Bitcoin’s price ju 375%, driven by demand for spot Bitcoin ETFs and optimism tied to Trump’s proposal to include Bitcoin in U.S. strategic reserves.
The government typically transfers forfeited Bitcoin to the U.S. Marshals Service, which conducts public auctions rather than direct sales on exchanges. These auctions mitigate market disruptions compared to exchange-based sell-offs, which could flood the market and cause steep price drops.
The U.S. government already missed out on big gains by liquidating Bitcoin early. Since beginning its BTC seizures, it sold 195,092 BTC for $366.5 million. At current prices, these holdings would be worth $18.25 billion, a missed profit of $17.9 billion.
Despite the scale of the planned auction, some analysts urge calm. Ki Young Ju, CEO of CryptoQuant, noted, “The U.S. government selling $6.5 billion could be absorbed in just a week. Do not panic.”
In October, the U.S. Supreme Court declined to hear a case about the ownership of 69,370 Bitcoin that was seized from the Silk Road dark web marketplace.
Battle Born Investments, a company claiming rights to the seized Bitcoin through a bankruptcy estate, had requested the review.
This follows earlier rulings from a district court in 2022 and an appellate court in 2023, both of which found that Battle Born did not have a valid claim to the Bitcoin seized after Silk Road’s closure in 2013.
The Supreme Court reviews only a small fraction of the cases submitted each year, selecting around 100 to 150 out of over 7,000 requests.
Earlier this year, the U.S. government transferred about $2 billion worth of Silk Road-linked Bitcoin using Coinbase Prime, the cryptocurrency custody service of the Marshals Service.
The U.S. Marshals Service , which is tasked with enforcing federal court orders, has contracted Coinbase for custodial services, paying $32.5 million for these services.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance
Economy, Business and Finance->financial and economic news

author: Rashan Dixon
title: Elon Musk's civil war predictions spark debate
text:
Elon Musk has repeatedly warned about the possibility of a civil war in Europe due to immigration.
“…we have witnessed something new & unprecedented.The billionaire owner of a tech platform publicly confronting an elected leader & using his platform to undermine his authority & incite violence.Britain’s 2024 summer riots were Elon Musk’s trial balloon” https://t.co/5XcDvGVPFS
— Ana Gomes (@AnaMartinsGomes) August 18, 2024
Over the past 10 months, he has posted about this topic at least eight times on his social media platform X. Musk’s comments gained significant attention earlier this month when he weighed in on the anti-immigration riots happening in Britain.
"Britain’s 2024 summer riots were Elon Musk’s trial balloon. He got away with it. And if you’re not terrified by both the extraordinary supranational power of that and the potential consequences, you should be." https://t.co/Zz8dQen0Ly
— Jan Skudlarek (@janskudlarek) August 19, 2024
“Civil war is inevitable,” he posted, a statement viewed 9.8 million times and drew a strong response from Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s office. Starmer rejected Musk’s prediction, saying there was “no justification” for such remarks, while other critics in the U.K. accused Musk of stoking tensions . Experts point out that Musk’s language is unusual for a corporate executive speaking publicly.
Read ⁦ @carolecadwalla ⁩ ⁦>> What Musk has done is to rip off the mask. He’s shown that you don’t even have to pretend to care. In Musk’s world, trust is mistrust and safety is censorship. His goal is chaos. And it’s coming. ↘️ https://t.co/6kZ7xnsi6p
— Marietje Schaake (@MarietjeSchaake) August 18, 2024
However, the idea of a civil war has become a common talking point among far-right activists who see such a conflict as not only inevitable but also desirable. Jon Lewis, a research fellow at George Washington University’s Program on Extremism , noted that “what you’re seeing in these calls for civil war is a white supremacist clarion call. It is a dog whistle.”
I love @carolecadwalla even though I hate most of what she shows us–mostly the harms done by technoauthoritarianism. Resistance begins with recognition. https://t.co/ONSHqwgsbL
— Rebecca Solnit (@RebeccaSolnit) August 18, 2024
Although Musk has not explicitly advocated for violence or mentioned the race or religion of refugees, experts caution that his words mirror the language used in white supremacist chat rooms where changing demographics are frequently discussed.
Lewis warned that Musk’s statements could inspire violence from others, saying, “It’s only a matter of time, unfortunately, before someone listens.
The far-right’s rhetoric surrounding a future civil war is part of a broader philosophical framework in which extremists believe that fueling tensions around issues like immigration could lead to wars, accelerating societal collapse and providing an opportunity to reshape society according to their ideals.
Musk’s rhetoric and rising tensions In 2019, a gunman who attacked a synagogue in Poway, California, expressed goals connected to a larger civil conflict.
Katie Paul, director of the nonprofit Tech Transparency Project, observed that many followers of the “Boogaloo” anti-government movement, who are eager to dismantle current societal systems, are now active on Musk’s app after being banned from other social media platforms. As one of the world’s wealthiest individuals and the CEO of both Tesla and SpaceX, in addition to his influence as the owner of X, Musk’s predictions carry significant weight. Recently, he has hosted conversations with prominent political figures on X, further amplifying his voice.
Musk has received support for his civil war predictions from individuals like Michael Flynn, a former national security adviser who responded to Musk’s posts by saying that the scenario of civil war is “underway.
However, experts in civil wars argue that Musk is out of his depth. They maintain that it is highly unlikely that Europe will experience a civil war due to immigration. Megan Stewart, an associate professor at the University of Michigan, stated, “Immigrants are not an organized rebel group ready to commit violence.” She emphasized that immigrants are often fleeing dangerous situations and simply trying to live their lives.
Thomas Zeitzoff, an associate professor at American University, cautioned that Musk’s predictions could fuel misleading fears about immigrants and potentially incite right-wing extremists who already hold such beliefs to take up arms. Despite Musk’s repeated forecasts, Europe has not experienced a civil war related to immigration. Historically, in the U.S. and the U.K., immigrants have been victims of violence perpetrated by right-wing extremists rather than instigators of conflict.
Musk’s posts continue to attract thousands of replies, reflecting both support and significant concern over the implications of his predictions.
